00118 #include "cache_content.h"

00124 
00142 #define arg_LOCKT4 op->nfs_argop4_u.oplockt
00143 #define res_LOCKT4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.oplockt
00144 
00145 int nfs4_op_lockt(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
00146                      compound_data_t   * data,
00147                      struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
00148 {
00149   char                       funcname[] = "nfs4_op_lockt" ;
00150   cache_inode_status_t       cache_status ;
00151   cache_inode_state_v4_t   * pfilelock = NULL ;
00152   nfs_client_id_t            nfs_client_id ;
00153   
00154   /* Lock are not supported */
00155   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_LOCKT ;
00156   res_LOCKT4.status =  NFS4ERR_LOCK_NOTSUPP ;
00157     
00158    
00159   
00160  /* If there is no FH */
00161   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Empty( &(data->currentFH  ) ) )
00162     {
00163       res_LOCKT4.status = NFS4ERR_NOFILEHANDLE ;
00164       return res_LOCKT4.status ; 
00165     }
00166  
00167   /* If the filehandle is invalid */
00168   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Invalid( &(data->currentFH ) ) )
00169     {
00170       res_LOCKT4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ; 
00171       return res_LOCKT4.status ; 
00172     }
00173  
00174   /* Tests if the Filehandle is expired (for volatile filehandle) */
00175   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Expired( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00176     {
00177       res_LOCKT4.status = NFS4ERR_FHEXPIRED ; 
00178       return res_LOCKT4.status ; 
00179     }
00180 
00181   /* Commit is done only on a file */
00182   if( data->current_filetype != REGULAR_FILE )
00183     {
00184         /* Type of the entry is not correct */
00185         switch( data->current_filetype )
00186           {
00187              case DIR_BEGINNING:
00188              case DIR_CONTINUE:
00189                 res_LOCKT4.status = NFS4ERR_ISDIR ; 
00190                 break ;
00191              default:
00192                 res_LOCKT4.status = NFS4ERR_INVAL ; 
00193                 break ;
00194           }
00195         return res_LOCKT4.status ;
00196     }
00197  
00198   /* Lock length should not be 0 */
00199   if( arg_LOCKT4.length == 0LL )
00200     {
00201        res_LOCKT4.status = NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
00202        return res_LOCKT4.status ;
00203     }
00204 
00205   /* Check for range overflow 
00206    * Remember that a length with all bits set to 1 means "lock until the end of file" (RFC3530, page 157) */
00207   if( arg_LOCKT4.length != 0xffffffffffffffffLL ) 
00208     {
00209         /* Comparing beyond 2^64 is not possible int 64 bits precision, but off+len > 2^64 is equivalent to len > 2^64 - off */
00210         if( arg_LOCKT4.length > ( 0xffffffffffffffffLL - arg_LOCKT4.offset ) )
00211           {
00212              res_LOCKT4.status = NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
00213              return res_LOCKT4.status ;
00214           }
00215     }
00216 
00217 
00218   /* Check clientid */
00219   if(  nfs_client_id_get( arg_LOCKT4.owner.clientid, 
00220                           &nfs_client_id ) != CLIENT_ID_SUCCESS )
00221     {
00222         res_LOCKT4.status = NFS4ERR_STALE_CLIENTID ;
00223         return res_LOCKT4.status ;
00224     }
00225 
00226   /* Check if there is a conflict with an existing lock */
00227   if( cache_inode_lock_test( data->current_entry, 
00228                              arg_LOCKT4.offset,  
00229                              arg_LOCKT4.length,
00230                              arg_LOCKT4.locktype,
00231                              &pfilelock,
00232                              data->pclient, 
00233                              &cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00234     {
00235         if( cache_status == CACHE_INODE_LOCK_CONFLICT )
00236          { 
00237            printf( "=====> LOCKT: (off=%llu,len=%llu) conflicts with offset=%llu length=%llu clientid=%llu asked_clientid=%llu\n", 
00238                   arg_LOCKT4.offset, arg_LOCKT4.length, pfilelock->data.lock.offset, pfilelock->data.lock.length, pfilelock->clientid4, arg_LOCKT4.owner.clientid ) ;
00239            if( pfilelock != NULL ) 
00240              {
00241                res_LOCKT4.LOCKT4res_u.denied.offset         = pfilelock->data.lock.offset ;
00242                res_LOCKT4.LOCKT4res_u.denied.length         = pfilelock->data.lock.length ;
00243                res_LOCKT4.LOCKT4res_u.denied.locktype       = pfilelock->data.lock.lock_type ;
00244                res_LOCKT4.LOCKT4res_u.denied.owner.clientid = pfilelock->clientid4 ;
00245               }
00246            res_LOCKT4.status = NFS4ERR_DENIED ;
00247 
00248         
00249           /* RFC3530, page 161: LOCKT should not returns a error for a conflict with a lock held by the current lockowner */
00250           if( pfilelock->clientid4 == arg_LOCKT4.owner.clientid )
00251            {
00252              res_LOCKT4.status = NFS4_OK ;
00253 
00254 #ifdef _NFS_V4_SERVER_NO_CONSOLIDATION_SUPPORT
00255              /* If lock overlaps, but if clientid is the same, returns NFS4_OK */
00256              res_LOCKT4.status = NFS4ERR_LOCK_RANGE ;
00257 #else
00258              /* If lock overlaps, but if clientid is the same, returns NFS4ERR_RANGE */
00259              res_LOCKT4.status = NFS4_OK ;
00260 #endif
00261            }
00262 
00263           return res_LOCKT4.status ;
00264          }
00265         else
00266          {
00267            res_LOCKT4.status = NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
00268            return res_LOCKT4.status ;
00269          }
00270     }
00271   
00272   /* Succssful exit */
00273   res_LOCKT4.status = NFS4_OK ;
00274   return res_LOCKT4.status;
00275 } /* nfs4_op_lockt */
00276 
00277     
00288 void nfs4_op_lockt_Free( LOCKT4res * resp )
00289 { 
00290   /* Nothing to Mem_Free */
00291   return ;
00292 } /* nfs4_op_lockt_Free */
Generated on Wed Apr 9 08:24:28 2008 for NFS and Mount protocols layer by  1.3.9.1
